Regent Theatre7 Medford Street, Arlington, MA 02474

It's Never Over, Jeff BuckleyAudience Q&A after the screening! Event TagsMoviefri15aug7:30 pm9:45 pm7:30 pm - 9:45 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

IT’S NEVER OVER: JEFF BUCKLEY, directed by Oscar-nominated filmmaker Amy Berg (DELIVER US FROM EVIL, JANIS: LITTLE GIRL BLUE, WEST OF MEMPHIS), covers the life of the rising young star with an

Event Details

IT’S NEVER OVER: JEFF BUCKLEY, directed by Oscar-nominated filmmaker Amy Berg (DELIVER US FROM EVIL, JANIS: LITTLE GIRL BLUE, WEST OF MEMPHIS), covers the life of the rising young star with an otherworldly voice and boundary-pushing artistry, who left the ’90s music world reeling when he died suddenly, at age 30, after the release of his critically acclaimed debut album “Grace.”

Told through never-before-seen footage from Buckley’s archives and intimate accounts from his mother Mary Guibert, former partners Rebecca Moore and Joan Wasser, Jeff’s former bandmates, including Michael Tighe and Parker Kindred, and luminaries like Ben Harper and Aimee Mann, IT’S NEVER OVER, JEFF BUCKLEY illuminates one of modern music’s most influential and enigmatic figures.

TICKET PRICES

General Admission: $20
Seniors (62+): $18
Veterans: $15
Patron- and Director-level Members: $15
Producer-level Members: FREE
BECOME A MEMBER TODAY

Runtime: 1 hour 49 minutes

General Information and Policies

Time

August 15, 2025 7:30 pm - 9:45 pm(GMT-04:00)

Location

Regent Theatre

7 Medford Street, Arlington, MA 02474

Rivers Edge Event TagsMoviesat16aug7:00 pm8:30 pm7:00 pm - 8:30 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

Rivers Edge explores the lives of twin siblings (Kash & Hadley Rivers) and their best friend (Riley Tellier), while navigating personal challenges, family tensions, and their aspirations for a fresh

Event Details

Rivers Edge explores the lives of twin siblings (Kash & Hadley Rivers) and their best friend (Riley Tellier), while navigating personal challenges, family tensions, and their aspirations for a fresh start.

Set against the backdrop of a small town, the story captures moments of humor, conflict, and introspection as they plan a transformative journey that promises to change their lives forever.

Themes of resilience, self-discovery, and the bonds of family and friendship drive this heartfelt coming-of-age tale.

LANGUAGE ADVISORY: the film may not be suitable for people under 16 years old.

 Ticket Prices

  • $20 General Admission
  • $18 Senior/Veteran
  • Member discounts apply
    $5 savings for Patron-level and Director-level
    Free entry for Producer-level

 

 

General Information and Policies

Time

August 16, 2025 7:00 pm - 8:30 pm(GMT-04:00)

Regent Theatre7 Medford Street, Arlington, MA 02474

Cat-Video-Fest 2025 Event TagsAnimals,cats,Moviesun17aug2:00 pm3:15 pm2:00 pm - 3:15 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

An encore screening of the world’s #1 cat video festival. After 4 packed crowds earlier this month, CatVideoFest is back for one more show!

Event Details

An encore screening of the world’s #1 cat video festival.
After 4 packed crowds earlier this month, CatVideoFest is back for one more show!


with Dr. Rachel S. Geller
Understanding Your Cat’s Behaviors and What They Mean

Do you want to understand why your cats do certain things?
Based in Newton, MA, Rachel S. Geller, Ed.D.
advises you on how to resolve your cat’s behavioral and emotional problems.

😺😺😺😺😺😺😺😺

Oscilloscope Laboratories presents CatVideoFest 2025, a compilation of the latest and best cat videos culled from countless hours of unique submissions and sourced animations, music videos, and classic internet powerhouses. Scroll down to watch the trailer!

Each year, across the country, local theaters partner with nearby cat-focused charities, animal welfare associations and shelters alike — a portion of ticket proceeds from every show goes directly to local cats in need. We are excited that the REGENT THEATRE is partnered with All Cats All The Time and 10% of the proceeds will go directly to Dr. Rachel Geller in order to fund that 501(c)3 organization she began recently.

General Admission: $17
Seniors / Students: $14
Veterans: $12

Group of 4 or more: $10 per seat.  Use discount code GROUP4

Patron- and Director-level Members: $12
Producer-level Members: FREE
BECOME A MEMBER TODAY!

Prices include all fees. 

Runtime: 74 minutes.

Rated:  G.

“Watching silly cat videos is good for you.” — The Wall Street Journal.

General Information and Policies

Time

August 17, 2025 2:00 pm - 3:15 pm(GMT-04:00)

Location

Regent Theatre

7 Medford Street, Arlington, MA 02474

Other Events

Get Directions

Hello, BeautifulDirector Ziad H. Hamzeh and Tricia Helfer (Leading Actress) are in-theatre. Event TagsMoviewed20aug7:30 pm9:30 pm7:30 pm - 9:30 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

A powerful and emotionally charged film that delves into the harrowing yet transformative journey of Willow, a successful model whose life is shattered by a devastating breast cancer diagnosis. Based

Event Details

A powerful and emotionally charged film that delves into the harrowing yet transformative journey of Willow, a successful model whose life is shattered by a devastating breast cancer diagnosis. Based on Christine Handy’s bestselling novel Walk Beside Me, the film explores themes of identity, resilience, and the enduring strength of the human spirit in the face of unimaginable adversity. Winner of The Golden Palm Award for Best Film at the 2025 Beverly Hills Film Festival and winner of The Best Drama at the 2025 Philadelphia Independent Film Festival.

The filmmaker and lead actress will be present to meet the public and answer questions after the film screens.

TICKET PRICES

General Admission: $20
Seniors (62+): $18
Veterans: $15
Patron- and Director-level Members: $15
Producer-level Members: FREE
BECOME A MEMBER TODAY

Runtime: 1 hour 38 minutes

General Information and Policies

Time

August 20, 2025 7:30 pm - 9:30 pm(GMT-04:00)

Location

Regent Theatre

Other Events

Regent Theatre7 Medford Street, Arlington, MA 02474

Lonely Seal Film Festival Event TagsFestival,Movie,musicwed20aug7:30 pm9:45 pm7:30 pm - 9:45 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

Returning for its 8th edition! Welcome to the home of stories “aching to be told.” Discover the unparalleled blend of tradition and innovation at The Lonely Seal International Film,

Event Details

Returning for its 8th edition! Welcome to the home of stories “aching to be told.” Discover the unparalleled blend of tradition and innovation at The Lonely Seal International Film, Screenplay & Music Festival.
Find out more at lonelysealfestival.com.

Wednesday, August 20 7:30 PM-9:45 PM

Hello, Beautiful (runtime 1h38m)

The cornerstones of Willow’s life begins to crumble. At the height of her career, Willow is diagnosed with breast cancer. Hello Beautiful is the story of a woman who peels away the layers to find her inner warrior, a woman who faces insurmountable odds and learns to treasure the gift of self worth and unconditional love.

Use this button to purchase tickets to Wednesday’s film screening

______________________________________________________

Thursday, August 21 6:30 PM-10:00 PM

Growing Pains (runtime 1h37m)

Two childhood best friends, Zoe and Nat, face the tumultuous changes of transitioning from middle to high school as their friendship drifts apart. Zoe, a cancer survivor, joins the crew team which exacerbates her body image & mental health struggles. Nat battles with her sexuality and the expectations of her parents.

 

The Full Fungus (runtime 1h42m)

Embattled LA private eye Chino Diamond is hired to track down Wilt, a mysterious man on the run with a set of fabled jazz tapes from late jazz legend Mink Fungus. As Chino navigates the seedy underbelly of Los Angeles, he finds himself dodging the ruthless henchmen of Koviak, a powerful mobster who wants the tapes for his own sinister plans. From dive bars to back-alley sushi joints, this animated noir romp blends wild characters, dry humor, and unexpected twists through a city as strange as its inhabitants.

Use this button to purchase tickets to Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday’s film screenings

______________________________________________________

Friday, August 22 7:00-PM-10:30 PM

7:00 PM-8:30 PM — Love Bug

Set in 1980s Los Angeles, a young man, Douglass, finds himself entangled in a relationship with Gracie, an eccentric hustler down on her luck. After their first time gettin’ jiggy, Gracie convinces the naive Douglass to become an adult film star under her management.

Driven by a deep-seated desire to belong, Douglass ventures down an increasingly dangerous path as Gracie’s charm and go-getter attitude launches “Douggy-Style” and his personalized self-tapes into stardom.

As their relationship deteriorates and it’s unclear if “Douggy-Style” is a star or just a pawn in Gracie’s game, Douglass will discover the extreme lengths he needs to go to claim his own autonomy.

 

8:45 PM-10:15 PM — Resilience & Sacrifice

An artist who shelved his musical aspirations to raise his family has a renewed spark to find his passion once again. He sets out on a harrowing journey to navigate the pitfalls of life, the music business, and an unexpected medical condition that threatens to end his career before it can truly take off. Along the way he uncovers the persistence of passion, the strength to endure, and an unwavering thirst to attain success against all odds. This isn’t just a story about AN artist – it’s a story about ALL artists

Use this button to purchase tickets to Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday’s film screenings

______________________________________________________

Saturday, August 23 10:00-AM-11:30 AM

Film Accessible is dedicated to showcasing cinema and filmed products with accessible themes and/or main characters, as well as projects made by accessible filmmakers. Lonely Seal Founder Hammad Zaidi is disabled, and one of his life’s missions is to promote accessible content.

  • The Blind Reggaetonera (28:00) A blind reggaeton artist defies societal barriers to pursue her musical dreams, redefining disability perceptions while mentoring young disabled students.
  • Our Island (7:33) A young man losing his sight due to a congenital condition does everything to avoid being a burden.
  • In the Eye of the Beholder (11:29) Ever since her senior year of high school, Taylor Leigh Aguilar pursued a career in filmmaking. That is until, halfway through earning her MFA in film production, she went completely blind.
  • EverForward (31:00) Denise Gorondy-Toderico was living an extraordinary life balancing it all – a wife, mother, triathlete and successful owner of a Veterinary practice. That all changed on June 5th, 2016. While she was out for her morning jog, Denise was struck by an under-the-influence driver. She was left for dead with a litany of life-changing injuries. EVERFORWARD follows Denise’s journey after this incident.
  • Teenage Dick: The Making Of (12:14) A behind the scenes making of the Curtin Theatre department’s production of Mike Lew’s stage play Teenage Dick, inspired by Shakespeare’s Richard III.  The film promotes discussion about the importance of improving access and inclusion opportunities for people with disabilities.

Use this button to purchase tickets to Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday’s film screenings

Sunday, August 24 11:50AM- 8:00 PM

11:50 AM – 12:50PM

Writer’s Block  – Celebrating the Writers. Celebrate the writers of the 2025 Lonely Seal Festival by learning about their selected stories. Mingle with some writers in attendance, imagine what could be next, and maybe even collaborate. Hosted by Hammad Zaidi.

 1:00 PM-2:55 PM 

The Spiritualization of Jeff Boyd (1:42:13) Jeff, a patient in a mental institution in the Swiss Alps, escapes to his friend Morton to start over at his bakery, while Prisha, a guru’s daughter, mysteriously enters Jeff’s life. After a fight with his friend, the fugitive leaves him behind and goes to a monk in the Balkans in search of enlightenment.

3:00 PM-4:30 PM 

Looking Up (1:11:30) Eitan Armon, a young man facing encroaching blindness, decides to let go of everything he can’t control and climb Yosemite’s most epic granite wall, El Capitan.

5:00 PM-6:45 PM 

Bear Brook (13:21) Fifteen years after his wife’s death, Jimmy’s children confront him on moving on with his life.

Urban Ed (1:30:00) When their charter school is shut down in the middle of the year, a group of inner city students comes up against America’s broken education system and a world full of contradicting lessons.

7:00 PM-8:00 PM

Award Ceremony. Join us to celebrate all of the wonderful participants of the festival as we announce the awards.

Use this button to purchase tickets to Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday’s film screenings

______________________________________________________

General Information and Policies

Time

August 20, 2025 7:30 pm - 9:45 pm(GMT-04:00)

Location

Regent Theatre

7 Medford Street, Arlington, MA 02474

Other Events

Get Directions

Returning for its 8th edition! Welcome to the home of stories “aching to be told.” Discover the unparalleled blend of tradition and innovation at The Lonely Seal International Film, Screenplay & Music Festival.
Find out more at lonelysealfestival.com.

Wednesday, August 20 7:30 PM-9:45 PM

Hello, Beautiful (runtime 1h38m)

The cornerstones of Willow’s life begins to crumble. At the height of her career, Willow is diagnosed with breast cancer. Hello Beautiful is the story of a woman who peels away the layers to find her inner warrior, a woman who faces insurmountable odds and learns to treasure the gift of self worth and unconditional love.

Use this button to purchase tickets to Wednesday’s film screening

______________________________________________________

Thursday, August 21 6:30 PM-10:00 PM

Growing Pains (runtime 1h37m)

Two childhood best friends, Zoe and Nat, face the tumultuous changes of transitioning from middle to high school as their friendship drifts apart. Zoe, a cancer survivor, joins the crew team which exacerbates her body image & mental health struggles. Nat battles with her sexuality and the expectations of her parents.

 

The Full Fungus (runtime 1h42m)

Embattled LA private eye Chino Diamond is hired to track down Wilt, a mysterious man on the run with a set of fabled jazz tapes from late jazz legend Mink Fungus. As Chino navigates the seedy underbelly of Los Angeles, he finds himself dodging the ruthless henchmen of Koviak, a powerful mobster who wants the tapes for his own sinister plans. From dive bars to back-alley sushi joints, this animated noir romp blends wild characters, dry humor, and unexpected twists through a city as strange as its inhabitants.

Use this button to purchase tickets to Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday’s film screenings

______________________________________________________

Friday, August 22 7:00-PM-10:30 PM

7:00 PM-8:30 PM — Love Bug

Set in 1980s Los Angeles, a young man, Douglass, finds himself entangled in a relationship with Gracie, an eccentric hustler down on her luck. After their first time gettin’ jiggy, Gracie convinces the naive Douglass to become an adult film star under her management.

Driven by a deep-seated desire to belong, Douglass ventures down an increasingly dangerous path as Gracie’s charm and go-getter attitude launches “Douggy-Style” and his personalized self-tapes into stardom.

As their relationship deteriorates and it’s unclear if “Douggy-Style” is a star or just a pawn in Gracie’s game, Douglass will discover the extreme lengths he needs to go to claim his own autonomy.

 

8:45 PM-10:15 PM — Resilience & Sacrifice

An artist who shelved his musical aspirations to raise his family has a renewed spark to find his passion once again. He sets out on a harrowing journey to navigate the pitfalls of life, the music business, and an unexpected medical condition that threatens to end his career before it can truly take off. Along the way he uncovers the persistence of passion, the strength to endure, and an unwavering thirst to attain success against all odds. This isn’t just a story about AN artist – it’s a story about ALL artists

Use this button to purchase tickets to Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday’s film screenings

______________________________________________________

Saturday, August 23 10:00-AM-11:30 AM

Film Accessible is dedicated to showcasing cinema and filmed products with accessible themes and/or main characters, as well as projects made by accessible filmmakers. Lonely Seal Founder Hammad Zaidi is disabled, and one of his life’s missions is to promote accessible content.

  • The Blind Reggaetonera (28:00) A blind reggaeton artist defies societal barriers to pursue her musical dreams, redefining disability perceptions while mentoring young disabled students.
  • Our Island (7:33) A young man losing his sight due to a congenital condition does everything to avoid being a burden.
  • In the Eye of the Beholder (11:29) Ever since her senior year of high school, Taylor Leigh Aguilar pursued a career in filmmaking. That is until, halfway through earning her MFA in film production, she went completely blind.
  • EverForward (31:00) Denise Gorondy-Toderico was living an extraordinary life balancing it all – a wife, mother, triathlete and successful owner of a Veterinary practice. That all changed on June 5th, 2016. While she was out for her morning jog, Denise was struck by an under-the-influence driver. She was left for dead with a litany of life-changing injuries. EVERFORWARD follows Denise’s journey after this incident.
  • Teenage Dick: The Making Of (12:14) A behind the scenes making of the Curtin Theatre department’s production of Mike Lew’s stage play Teenage Dick, inspired by Shakespeare’s Richard III.  The film promotes discussion about the importance of improving access and inclusion opportunities for people with disabilities.

Use this button to purchase tickets to Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday’s film screenings

Sunday, August 24 11:50AM- 8:00 PM

11:50 AM – 12:50PM

Writer’s Block  – Celebrating the Writers. Celebrate the writers of the 2025 Lonely Seal Festival by learning about their selected stories. Mingle with some writers in attendance, imagine what could be next, and maybe even collaborate. Hosted by Hammad Zaidi.

 1:00 PM-2:55 PM 

The Spiritualization of Jeff Boyd (1:42:13) Jeff, a patient in a mental institution in the Swiss Alps, escapes to his friend Morton to start over at his bakery, while Prisha, a guru’s daughter, mysteriously enters Jeff’s life. After a fight with his friend, the fugitive leaves him behind and goes to a monk in the Balkans in search of enlightenment.

3:00 PM-4:30 PM 

Looking Up (1:11:30) Eitan Armon, a young man facing encroaching blindness, decides to let go of everything he can’t control and climb Yosemite’s most epic granite wall, El Capitan.

5:00 PM-6:45 PM 

Bear Brook (13:21) Fifteen years after his wife’s death, Jimmy’s children confront him on moving on with his life.

Urban Ed (1:30:00) When their charter school is shut down in the middle of the year, a group of inner city students comes up against America’s broken education system and a world full of contradicting lessons.

7:00 PM-8:00 PM

Award Ceremony. Join us to celebrate all of the wonderful participants of the festival as we announce the awards.

The Rise and Fall of The Clash Redux Event TagsMoviewed27aug7:30 pm9:30 pm7:30 pm - 9:30 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

The Rise And Fall Of The Clash features previously unseen footage of the band at work and at play, interviews with the individual band members and with those who knew

Event Details

The Rise And Fall Of The Clash features previously unseen footage of the band at work and at play, interviews with the individual band members and with those who knew them well, and traces the downward trajectory of a band who were at one point “the biggest band in the world”.

This is not a film that pulls any punches, but neither does it overlook the life-changing effect that The Clash brought to so many. Over 90 minutes it paints the fascinating inside story of rivalry, treachery and betrayal, and the internal band dynamics and managerial interference that ultimately led The Clash to self-destruct.

runtime 1h 49m

TICKET PRICES

General Admission: $20
Seniors (62+): $18
Veterans: $15
Patron- and Director-level Members: $15
Producer-level Members: FREE
BECOME A MEMBER TODAY

Canadian Arabic Orchestra: Sing Alonga unique experience where the audience is invited to sing along with the choir and musicians while lyrics are projected on a screen Event TagsArabic,Cultural,Livefri05sep7:30 pm7:30 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

The Canadian Arabic Orchestra, based in Toronto, Canada, has had the pleasure of performing across the country and in Europe. The evening program is called “Sing

Event Details

The Canadian Arabic Orchestra, based in Toronto, Canada, has had the pleasure of performing across the country and in Europe.

The evening program is called “Sing Along”—a unique experience where the audience is invited to sing along with the choir and musicians while lyrics are projected on a screen. The music selection consists mostly of classics from the 70s and 80s. Audiences experience high levels of engagement and excitement during and after the performance.

Chris Ruggiero...the 50's 60's & 70's come alive!Joined by Back in Time and Clint Holmes! Event TagsLive,musicfri19sep7:30 pm7:30 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

Chris Ruggiero sings pop-rock standards of the 60s and 70s Chris Ruggiero takes his audience on

Event Details

Chris Ruggiero sings pop-rock standards of the 60s and 70s

Chris Ruggiero takes his audience on a journey through the golden age of Rock ‘n’ Roll, breathing new life into the classic hits from the greatest era of American music. What Michael Bublé did for the swing music of the 40s and 50s, Chris Ruggiero does for the pop-rock standards of the 60s and 70s. He has premiered and sold out his new show in Las Vegas and is now touring in theaters throughout the U.S.A.. Openers for the night will be Back In Time, as Sidney Hall (The Flamingos) brings, “I Only Have Eyes for You” and others from the Do Wop era.

 

SEAT PRICES

Premium: $49
Preferred: $39
Reserved: $29
Senior and Veteran discounts apply. All fees included.

Southern Steel: Classic Skynyrd Live Event TagsLive,musicsat20sep8:00 pm8:00 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

Experience the explosive sound of Southern rock as Southern Steel brings Classic Skynyrd Live to the Regent Theatre! From timeless anthems like “Free Bird” and “Sweet Home Alabama” to deep cuts that defined a

Event Details

Experience the explosive sound of Southern rock as Southern Steel brings Classic Skynyrd Live to the Regent Theatre! From timeless anthems like “Free Bird” and “Sweet Home Alabama” to deep cuts that defined a generation, this tribute delivers the full-throttle energy and authentic sound of Lynyrd Skynyrd at their peak.

As the Northeast’s go-to openers for The Outlaws, Southern Steel has earned a loyal following for a reason — every show is packed with crowd-pleasing hits, soaring guitar solos, and no-holds-barred Southern soul. Whether you’re a die-hard fan or new to the Skynyrd legacy, this is your chance to experience the music the way it was meant to be heard: loud, live, and legendary.

SEAT PRICES

Premium: $59
Preferred: $49
Reserved: $39

WUMB SAMW 30th Anniversary ConcertArlington's Show Place of Entertainment!sun21sep5:00 pm5:00 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

WUMB is very pleased to present a special concert celebrating 30 years of our Summer Acoustic Music Week (SAMW) camps. The WUMB Acoustic Music Camps offer musical instruction in a welcoming

Event Details

WUMB is very pleased to present a special concert celebrating 30 years of our Summer Acoustic Music Week (SAMW) camps.

The WUMB Acoustic Music Camps offer musical instruction in a welcoming and supportive environment to adult students who want to learn or refine their skills and immerse themselves in the music they want to create.

Join us this September to celebrate SAMW’s 30th Year Anniversary with musical performances from:

  • Kate Campbell
  • Guy Davis
  • The Kennedys
  • John Kirk & Trish Miller
  • Kerri Powers

This celebration will also be honoring Lorraine Hammond, Co-Founder and Music Director of SAMW.

Premium: $85
Preferred: $70
Reserved: $60
WUMB Member discount available

ULTRASONIC ROCK ORCHESTRAFeaturing original members of the URO Event TagsLive,musicfri26sep8:00 pm8:00 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

For 18 years the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra, led by co-founders Sal Clemente and Alan Ware, brought blistering rock and roll and amazing theatricality to the Regent Theatre stage as

Event Details

For 18 years the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra, led by co-founders Sal Clemente and Alan Ware, brought blistering rock and roll and amazing theatricality to the Regent Theatre stage as well as other venerable venues like Boston’s Wilbur Theater and The Fox Theater at Foxwoods, Connecticut. But in the early hours of January 1st, 2023, the Regent–where it had all begun in 2004–was the setting for their final curtain call. It was the end of an era for a group of women and men who banded together to play the music they loved and along the way became a family–one that extended over time to legions of enthusiastic fans throughout New England. This epic first era of the URO established them as a unique Rock Big Band with an astounding, ever expanding live “mixtape” repertoire of British and American rock classics–even staging acclaimed, mind-blowing live concert album experiences such as “Jesus Christ Superstar,” “Ziggy Stardust,” “The White Album,” and “Abbey Road!”

 

Rock and Roll, much like nature, abhors a vacuum, and after two–and–a–half years the music that the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra played like no other demands to be heard once more! With the blessings of Sal and Alan—and under the guidance of our Producer, Maria Mae Hamilton and Musical Director, Mike Murray—the URO will return to our home base to begin a new era.  

 

SEAT PRICES 

  • PREMIUM: $69

  • PREFERRED: $59 

  • RESERVED: $49

  • REAR: $39

Featuring some returning members along with exciting new personnel, this iteration of the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra will bring you ALL NEW SONGS from eras of Classic Rock that we have NEVER performed before!  We will strive to be worthy of the legacy of this group, and together will deliver the magic and wonder that the URO has been known for! More will be revealed in the coming weeks and months as we lead up to our grand re-debut this Fall when “a splendid time is guaranteed to all!“ 

 

(Just don’t ask us for the set list… that’s a closely guarded secret.)

 

You know how the fans felt about the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra. Here’s what the press wrote:
“An awe-inspiring night of high energy and over-the-top rock fun, The URO brings off even the most intricate of rock pieces with effortless ease, light-hearted humor, and an audacious display of vocal prowess.” — Boston Globe
“A grandiose fist-in-the-air salute to all things rock.” — Boston Herald

ULTRASONIC ROCK ORCHESTRAFeaturing original members of the URO Event TagsLive,musicsat27sep8:00 pm8:00 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

For 18 years the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra, led by co-founders Sal Clemente and Alan Ware, brought blistering rock and roll and amazing theatricality to the Regent Theatre stage as

Event Details

For 18 years the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra, led by co-founders Sal Clemente and Alan Ware, brought blistering rock and roll and amazing theatricality to the Regent Theatre stage as well as other venerable venues like Boston’s Wilbur Theater and The Fox Theater at Foxwoods, Connecticut. But in the early hours of January 1st, 2023, the Regent–where it had all begun in 2004–was the setting for their final curtain call. It was the end of an era for a group of women and men who banded together to play the music they loved and along the way became a family–one that extended over time to legions of enthusiastic fans throughout New England. This epic first era of the URO established them as a unique Rock Big Band with an astounding, ever expanding live “mixtape” repertoire of British and American rock classics–even staging acclaimed, mind-blowing live concert album experiences such as “Jesus Christ Superstar,” “Ziggy Stardust,” “The White Album,” and “Abbey Road!”

 

Rock and Roll, much like nature, abhors a vacuum, and after two–and–a–half years the music that the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra played like no other demands to be heard once more! With the blessings of Sal and Alan—and under the guidance of our Producer, Maria Mae Hamilton and Musical Director, Mike Murray—the URO will return to our home base to begin a new era.  

 

SEAT PRICES 

  • PREMIUM: $69

  • PREFERRED: $59 

  • RESERVED: $49

  • REAR: $39

Featuring some returning members along with exciting new personnel, this iteration of the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra will bring you ALL NEW SONGS from eras of Classic Rock that we have NEVER performed before!  We will strive to be worthy of the legacy of this group, and together will deliver the magic and wonder that the URO has been known for! More will be revealed in the coming weeks and months as we lead up to our grand re-debut this Fall when “a splendid time is guaranteed to all!“ 

 

(Just don’t ask us for the set list… that’s a closely guarded secret.)

 

You know how the fans felt about the Ultrasonic Rock Orchestra. Here’s what the press wrote:
“An awe-inspiring night of high energy and over-the-top rock fun, The URO brings off even the most intricate of rock pieces with effortless ease, light-hearted humor, and an audacious display of vocal prowess.” — Boston Globe
“A grandiose fist-in-the-air salute to all things rock.” — Boston Herald
“The level of talent on display is immense, the URO makes use of every musician and vocalist present to capture the most complex of these classic songs.” — THE NOISE
“Only a handful of bands are licensed to rock you that hard, and the Ultrasonic ROck Orchestra certainly has that license.” — THE METRO

Event Details

The 28th Annual
MANHATTAN SHORT Film Festival

ONE WORLD – ONE WEEK – ONE FESTIVAL

Join us September 28 to October 5, 2025, when over 100,000 film lovers in over 500 cities across six continents gather for one reason…to view and vote on the Finalists’ Films in the 28th Annual MANHATTAN SHORT Film Festival.

Look here in September for a list of featured films.

 

SEAT PRICES
General Admission: $18
Seniors: $16
Veterans: $15
Patron- and Director-level Members: $13
Producer-level Members: FREE
BECOME A MEMBER TODAY!

FESTIVAL HISTORY
MANHATTAN SHORT began in 1998, when founder Nicholas Mason gathered an audience of 200 people and showed 16 short films on a screen mounted to the side of a truck on Mulberry Street, Little Italy, New York City. A year later the Festival moved uptown to Union Square Park NYC, where audiences grew to love the annual event. From these humble beginnings, MANHATTAN SHORT has now transformed into a worldwide phenomenon. Celebrating its 27th birthday in 2024, MANHATTAN SHORT is the only film festival on the planet to unfold simultaneously, in more than 500 cinemas on six continents, bringing over 100,000 film-lovers in all corners of the globe together for one week, via the next generation of filmmakers.

Event Details

This is a Ukrainian language performance

Ukrainian rock band, which can rightly be considered one of the best. BEZ OBMEZHEN – it is always a drive and emotion, a rhythm that penetrates to the depths of the soul the story told in each song. The guys mostly perform songs in the Ukrainian language, they have very few Russian-language songs.

BEZ OBMEZHEN undoubtedly like young people and older guests. The lead singer has a beautiful expressive voice, as well as charisma and the ability to keep the hall in good shape. Therefore, ordering this team, you get a real spectacular show. Your guests will be able to sing along, dance on the stage and spend an unforgettable evening.

Mamma Mania!NYC’s Premier ABBA Tribute Event TagsLive,musicfri03oct8:00 pm8:00 pm(GMT-04:00)

Event Details

Prepare to be transported back to the vibrant 1970s with 2025’s #1 booked ABBA Tribute!   Mamma Mania! brings the classic hits of one of pop music’s most

Event Details

Prepare to be transported back to the vibrant 1970s with 2025’s #1 booked ABBA Tribute!   Mamma Mania! brings the classic hits of one of pop music’s most iconic groups to life. With their dazzling costumes, flawless harmonies, and captivating stage presence, this tribute captures the essence of ABBA’s unforgettable sound.

From “Dancing Queen” to “Mamma Mia,” fans will enjoy a night filled with nostalgia from a stellar cast of musicians!  Performers include current or former touring members of: Mamma Mia – Official North American Tour, Marc Martel’s Queen Extravaganza, INXS, Britney Spears, Rob Thomas, The Weeknd and many more!   Mamma Mania! pays homage to ABBA’s legacy, celebrating the timeless melodies and uplifting lyrics that have charmed listeners for generations.

Join us for an evening of music that showcases not only the incredible songs but also the joyful spirit of ABBA. Whether you’re a lifelong fan or new to their music, this tribute promises to be an unforgettable experience filled with energy, enthusiasm, and plenty of dancing. Don’t miss your chance to be part of this extraordinary celebration of ABBA from some of New York’s finest!!

GENERAL PUBLIC TICKETS AVAILABLE AT 12:00 NOON, MONDAY, JULY 14

SEAT PRICES

Premium: $54
Preferred: $44
Reserved: $39
Senior and veteran discounts apply

Event Details

Formed in 2022, Floydian Trip is a seven-member tribute band dedicated to recreating the energy and sound of Pink Floyd’s classic tours. Drawing on everything from official releases to rare

Event Details

Formed in 2022, Floydian Trip is a seven-member tribute band dedicated to recreating the energy and sound of Pink Floyd’s classic tours. Drawing on everything from official releases to rare bootleg recordings, the group aims to deliver an authentic experience grounded in musical detail and respect for the original performances. Their 2025 tour focuses on honoring the 50th anniversary of Wish You Were Here, bringing fans an authentic tribute to one of rock’s most enduring albums.

SEAT PRICES

TIER 1: $39
TIER 2: $29

All fees included.

Event Details

Love, Death & Ketchup is Varun Grover’s new standup solo that tackles two of his worst fears: death and the world running out of ketchup. Loaded with many morbid-bizarre stories from his life, Love, Death & Ketchup is Varun’s most personal and experimental show yet.

THIS IS A HINDI LANGUAGE EVENT
